protocol_name: Copy of Oral feeding of bacteria to house flies for microbe fate and gene expression analysis
protocol_name_html: Copy of Oral feeding of bacteria to house flies for microbe fate and gene expression analysis
description:
{"blocks":[{"key":"fio55","text":"Objective: To feed individual house flies a specific amount of bacteria in order to
determine bacteria “fate” (persistence, via enumeration; spatiotemporal location, via
microscopy) and house fly immune response (whole fly or tissue-specific, via downstream mRNA or protein expression analyses) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71o05","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1st6u","text":"
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":1,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":{}},{"key":"bvbis","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":1,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fhgrq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"32558","guid":"CC2975C0E43C11E8A2AB618007007698","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/93qz7gn.png","placeholder":"","original_name":"fly droplet feeding.png","mime":"image/png","width":289,"height":null,"is_video":false,"legend":"","is_image":true}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"32565","guid":"A449C8B0E44711E890976B1B68D4377E","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/93xz7gn.png","placeholder":"","original_name":"oral bacteria feeding downstream analyses summary diagram.png","mime":"image/png","width":487.7833251953125,"height":null,"is_video":false,"legend":"","is_image":true}}}}
before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"1j6la","text":"Note: The bacteria culture conditions (e.g. media including antibiotics) will vary based on the\nbacteria species and plasmid, if any.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"3g659","text":"Collect pupae from colony and surface sanitize for 2 minutes each with gentle swirling in 10% bleach, sterile H2O, 100% ethanol, sterile\u00a0H2O. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":111,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":113,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":138,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ksmt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"a23ss","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c2m56","text":"Store pupae in a sterile container (e.g. petri dish, secured with rubber band or tape) or individually-house in 15 ml conical tubes until eclosion.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ct7h","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ag699","text":"Hold in incubator at 28\u00b0C, or if extra time is needed you can hold at\u00a0room temperature\u00a0which may slow development by a few days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7slr6","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eivdv","text":"Separate emerged flies from puparia after eclosion to reduce contamination by trans-stadial bacteria.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"71on9","text":"NOTE: surface sanitization is optional, and may delay eclosion.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"24406A11ED78458A93D65080910FD6EC","id":631595,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Preparing House Flies for Bacterial Feeding"}
steps.section: Preparing House Flies for Bacterial Feeding

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"47n9g","text":"Prepare fly containers: Use either small petri dishes, 50 ml beakers covered with foil, or small plastic containers withlids (make air holes with pin).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"phj3","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2naq4","text":"Autoclave or sanitize containers by washing (sterile petri dishes are ready to use). In each container, place a small square of parafilm (~15 x 15 mm) in the bottom; this is where you will place the food droplet (image below in step 7). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5qsu4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"E8CFDEF416EA456FBF4F7C77E4818F11","id":631596,"previous_id":631595,"previous_guid":"24406A11ED78458A93D65080910FD6EC","section":"Preparing House Flies for Bacterial Feeding"}
steps.section: Preparing House Flies for Bacterial Feeding

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"8j86r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"doee9","text":"Before adding flies to the containers, prepare sterile meal of 10% fly food solution or 10% sucrose and pipet 5-10 \u00b5l\u00a0onto the parafilm squares in the containers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6iior","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4s0ot","text":"Knock down flies with CO2 or put\u00a0in the freezer (~3 min) and transfer each fly to the container using soft forceps, then close lid tightly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":24,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f6b4s","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9qm0u","text":"The fly will wake up and eventually will eat the droplet, which serves to (a) flush any remaining bacteria from the fly gut and (b) provide basic sustenance before fasting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"82jma","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"0":"<","1":"p","2":">","3":"F","4":"o","5":"r","6":" ","7":"e","8":"x","9":"p","10":"e","11":"r","12":"i","13":"m","14":"e","15":"n","16":"t","17":"s","18":",","19":" ","20":"i","21":"t","22":"\u2019","23":"s","24":" ","25":"b","26":"e","27":"s","28":"t","29":" ","30":"t","31":"o","32":" ","33":"u","34":"s","35":"e","36":" ","37":"n","38":"e","39":"w","40":"l","41":"y","42":" ","43":"e","44":"m","45":"e","46":"r","47":"g","48":"e","49":"d","50":",","51":" ","52":"2","53":"-","54":"3","55":" ","56":"d","57":"a","58":"y","59":" ","60":"o","61":"l","62":"d","63":" ","64":"f","65":"l","66":"i","67":"e","68":"s","69":"<","70":"\/","71":"p","72":">","blocks":[{"key":"doulf","text":"For experiments, it\u2019s best to use newly eclosed, 2-3 day old flies","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"451E6A995D074E949CDCE8DF5D12D49D","id":631597,"previous_id":631596,"previous_guid":"E8CFDEF416EA456FBF4F7C77E4818F11","section":"Preparing House Flies for Bacterial Feeding"}
steps.section: Preparing House Flies for Bacterial Feeding

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"1g3mj","text":"Hold flies at room temperature and either fast for 12 hours and proceed to step 5 or fast and flush again with a sterile 10% sucrose meal, then fast 12 h a second time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8hvld","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8calp","text":"To add a second meal, briefly anesthetize with CO2 or chilling first, then add droplet by pipettor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":49,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9ni9i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6fggm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"B2670DF1CC3E4072A109CA0AA9A6AC42","id":631598,"previous_id":631597,"previous_guid":"451E6A995D074E949CDCE8DF5D12D49D","section":"Preparing House Flies for Bacterial Feeding"}
steps.section: Preparing House Flies for Bacterial Feeding

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"9b4oa","text":"After 12 hour fasting, place the flies in the incubator at 37\u00b0C for ~15 min and then remove back to room temperature carefully place 2 \u00b5l droplet of bacterial culture onto the parafilm square.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bfkks","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":1,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"c84in","text":" ","101":"t","102":"h","103":"e","104":"m","105":" ","106":"u","107":"p","108":" ","109":"b","110":"r","111":"i","112":"e","113":"f","114":"l","115":"y","116":" ","117":"t","118":"o","119":" ","120":"f","121":"e","122":"e","123":"d","124":"<","125":"\/","126":"p","127":">","blocks":[{"key":"f3top","text":"It may be necessary to anesthetize flies in order to place the droplet without having the fly escape.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"boumb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"41od9","text":"Be sure to check whether the entire 2 \u00b5l has been dispensed from the pipetter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"D0CBFFEC4EF04795BB65E1A1819CBABA","id":631605,"previous_id":631603,"previous_guid":"4053D6A49A8D4F0394CB2132FDBF7166","section":"Feeding steps.section: Feeding House Flies on Culture Droplets
Feeding House Flies on Culture Droplets

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"f819","text":"After all flies consume the 2 \u00b5l droplet, serially dilute the stock culture (from which the fed aliquot came) in sterile media and plate on selective agar to enumerate the CFU of bacteria fed to the flies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"co3dk","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6tktq","text":"E.g., you would take 100 \u00b5l of stock culture, serially dilute in 900 \u00b5l each of media with antibiotics (or sterile PBS) and plate the appropriate dilutions on solid media with antibiotics*.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2k5s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ad0bq","text":"Incubate plates at 37\u00b0C for 24 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ifd3","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9n496","text":"Count colonies on UV lightbox, to be sure you only count the GFP colonies*.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b542f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"9e9l8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d8utv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8lk4n","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":1,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"e1on6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"cjhfr","text":"* Most of the microbes fed to flies for downstream assays are genetically modified, containing plasmids with antibiotic resistance markers and usually a flourescent tag (e.g. GFP). This allows for selection on media and differentiation of the microbe of interest (which will be expressing GFP and will grow in the presence of the particular antibiotics) and other \"flora\" which may still be present in the gut.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}},{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"32557","guid":"BDF47C80E43B11E89D707500ABA97895","source":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/93pz7gn.png","placeholder":"","original_name":"gfp bact.png","mime":"image\/png","width":243.7833251953125,"height":null,"is_video":false,"legend":"","is_image":true}}],"guid":"1D5981F5336E4B9AB716113DC17CFA4A","id":631607,"previous_id":631606,"previous_guid":"12953050E2564D4A9ED456730D43BB5D","section":"Droplet enumeration"}
